There's a difference between playing with the intent to win and playing with the intent to troll and be a jerk. There was [a case like this 4 months ago](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/FrILlWp7-14-day-ban-because-playing-nunu-support-with-smite-is-stealing-other-peoples-roles?comment=00f0) where a player was banned for constantly forcing their way to play on their team and refusing to effectively communicate and adapt to the needs of their teammates. This is a team game after all and not a single-player game, and even [The Summoner's Code](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/summoners-code) (before it got updated) says to "Enjoy yourself, but not at anyone's expense." On today's SC, the most appropriate comparison there is as followed: 

>**Play as a team, win as a team!**

>A coordinated team is extremely difficult to take down. No matter how hard you feel like you’re carrying individually, blaming others and refusing to co-operate with teammates gives your opponent an advantage.

Basically to sum it up it's fine to want to try new and wacky things but you have to be respectful of your teams wishes too-this is a multi-player game after all. Yes teammates should be flexible as well, but if they're just not comfortable trying out your idea then maybe you should just suck it up and deal with it instead of causing a scene so-to-speak.
